segment.source: Include Files and Settings (Windows 10)
segment.target: Include Files and Settings (Windows 10)

segment.source: Include Files and Settings
segment.target: Include Files and Settings

segment.source: Include Files and Settings
segment.target: Include Files and Settings

segment.source: When you specify the migration .xml files, User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 migrates the settings and components specified in What Does USMT Migrate?
segment.target: When you specify the migration .xml files, User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 migrates the settings and components specified in What Does USMT Migrate?

segment.source: To include additional files and settings, we recommend that you create a custom .xml file and then include this file when using both the ScanState and LoadState commands.
segment.target: To include additional files and settings, we recommend that you create a custom .xml file and then include this file when using both the ScanState and LoadState commands.

segment.source: By creating a custom .xml file, you can keep your changes separate from the default .xml files, which makes it easier to track your modifications.
segment.target: By creating a custom .xml file, you can keep your changes separate from the default .xml files, which makes it easier to track your modifications.

segment.target: Migrate a Single Registry Key

segment.source: The following .xml file migrates a single registry key.
segment.target: The following .xml file migrates a single registry key.

segment.source: Migrate a Specific Folder
segment.target: Migrate a Specific Folder

segment.source: The following examples show how to migrate a folder from a specific drive, and from any location on the computer.
segment.target: The following examples show how to migrate a folder from a specific drive, and from any location on the computer.

segment.source: Migrate a Folder from a Specific Drive
segment.target: Migrate a Folder from a Specific Drive

segment.source: Including subfolders.
segment.target: Including subfolders.

segment.source: The following .xml file migrates all files and subfolders from C:EngineeringDrafts to the destination computer.
segment.target: The following .xml file migrates all files and subfolders from C:EngineeringDrafts to the destination computer.

segment.source: Excluding subfolders.
segment.target: Excluding subfolders.

segment.source: The following .xml file migrates all files from C:EngineeringDrafts, but it does not migrate any subfolders within C:EngineeringDrafts.
segment.target: The following .xml file migrates all files from C:EngineeringDrafts, but it does not migrate any subfolders within C:EngineeringDrafts.

segment.source: Migrate a Folder from Any Location
segment.target: Migrate a Folder from Any Location

segment.source: The following .xml file migrates all files and subfolders of the EngineeringDrafts folder from any drive on the computer.
segment.target: The following .xml file migrates all files and subfolders of the EngineeringDrafts folder from any drive on the computer.

segment.source: If multiple folders exist with the same name, then all files with this name are migrated.
segment.target: If multiple folders exist with the same name, then all files with this name are migrated.

segment.source: The following .xml file migrates all files and subfolders of the EngineeringDrafts folder from any location on the C: drive.
segment.target: The following .xml file migrates all files and subfolders of the EngineeringDrafts folder from any location on the C: drive.

segment.source: If multiple folders exist with the same name, they are all migrated.
segment.target: If multiple folders exist with the same name, they are all migrated.

segment.source: Migrate a File Type Into a Specific Folder
segment.target: Migrate a File Type Into a Specific Folder

segment.source: The following .xml file migrates .mp3 files located in the specified drives on the source computer into the C:Music folder on the destination computer.
segment.target: The following .xml file migrates .mp3 files located in the specified drives on the source computer into the C:Music folder on the destination computer.

segment.source: Migrate a Specific File
segment.target: Migrate a Specific File

segment.source: The following examples show how to migrate a file from a specific folder, and how to migrate a file from any location.
segment.target: The following examples show how to migrate a file from a specific folder, and how to migrate a file from any location.

segment.source: To migrate a file from a folder.
segment.target: To migrate a file from a folder.

segment.source: The following .xml file migrates only the Sample.doc file from C:EngineeringDrafts on the source computer to the destination computer.
segment.target: The following .xml file migrates only the Sample.doc file from C:EngineeringDrafts on the source computer to the destination computer.

segment.source: To migrate a file from any location.
segment.target: To migrate a file from any location.

segment.source: To migrate the Sample.doc file from any location on the C: drive, use the pattern element, as the following example shows.
segment.target: To migrate the Sample.doc file from any location on the C: drive, use the pattern element, as the following example shows.

segment.source: If multiple files exist with the same name on the C: drive, all of files with this name are migrated.
segment.target: If multiple files exist with the same name on the C: drive, all of files with this name are migrated.

segment.source: To migrate the Sample.doc file from any drive on the computer, use script as the following example shows.
segment.target: To migrate the Sample.doc file from any drive on the computer, use script as the following example shows.

segment.source: If multiple files exist with the same name, all files with this name are migrated.
segment.target: If multiple files exist with the same name, all files with this name are migrated.
